title: Can we move the surrender timer to 15 minutes?
body: Games are not lasting as long anymore. Games are more obvious now for who is going to win. So a 15 min surrender timer seems more appropriate.

Have you ever watched Starcraft? I know next to nothing about the game but the games are surrendered in like 5 minutes.

1 side sends over something small, the enemy see its. GG surrendered. Hands down the most boring thing ever.

Starcraft functions entirely differently than league. No one GGs in response to something small, because more often than not that "small thing" is something that your build order literally doesn't allow you to handle. There are many situations where the proper response to whatever an opponent is doing is to just walk up and kill him.

Starcraft strategy is largely centered around timings, which are centered around the economic capacity of a race in relation to a build the race is trying to pull off. Scouting is considerably less important if you have memorized all the optimal build times. If there was a WoL TvP, and the Terran did a 1-1-1 all in, and the Protoss did anything other than a 15 Nexus, the Protoss automatically loses, because The Terran can both make more stuff and his stuff is better at killing than anything the protoss will have out by the time a 1-1-1 all in hits.

As much as I agree that games are not lasting as long, there are many people who start to give up before the game even starts. Or even if we have an advantage, or if we have the potential to outscale the enemy team. I am really worried because it's already a problem now when my teammates decide to give up and spam surrender after 20 minutes, imagine if it was 15. There are some people who troll or stay base when I refuse to accept surrender.

I would surely agree with moving the surrender timer to 15 minutes ONLY to games in which your team has an AFK since the beginning. However, for other games, I am not really sure since this could encourage people to give up, and there are many people who already give up too easily.

If you and your team are playing in such a way that a game becomes unwinnable as quickly as the 15 min mark, then there someone wrong, and simply surrendering to move on to throw the next game is only going to cause these issues to occur more often.

You haven't played much low ranking (bronze/silver) solo que have you? People fed that bad sometimes. Other times an opponent snowballs. This recent update made the heavy snowball prone champions snowball harder and quicker then ever.

I honestly think this issue will sort itself out. People are still learning about the new items and such (I personally still haven't killed a rift Herald), so they're more likely to mess up really badly. 
For example, it's true that laning phase is likely to be over quicker than it was before. But I'm not seeing players adapt by going into teamfighting ealier. Right now, theres this period of "small skirmishes" that happen once a tower goes down. Since skirmishes don't involve as many players, the guy who won his lane isn't likely to get "focused" down. He'll probably just fight the guy who's already behind in lane, with some scarce help from the jungler (getting even more fed), while the other lanes that still have towers make believe that laning phase still goes on until 15-20 minutes.

Anyway. I think this will sort itself out. If not, it'll get patched.
